Module JBubbleBobble
Package game.model.entities

Class Player

java.lang.Object
game.model.entities.Entity
game.model.entities.MovingEntity
game.model.entities.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Gravity, Jumping, Shooting, Vulnerable
public class Player extends MovingEntity implements Gravity, Jumping, Shooting, Vulnerable
The Player class represents the player character in the game. It extends the MovingEntity class and provides additional functionality such as jumping, shooting bubbles, and managing player lives. This class implements the singleton pattern to ensure only one player instance exists in the game.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class game.model.entities.MovingEntity

    • gravity

      public void gravity()
      Applies gravity to the entity, increasing its air speed up to a maximum value if the entity is not grounded. This method simulates the effect of gravity on the entity when it is in the air.
      Specified by:
      gravity in interface Gravity

    • jump

      public void jump()
      Makes the player jump, setting them into the air with a negative vertical speed. Also increments the number of jumps in the power-up manager.
      Specified by:
      jump in interface Jumping

    • looseLife

      public void looseLife()
      Handles the player's loss of life, decrementing its lives.
      Specified by:
      looseLife in interface Vulnerable

    • heal

      public void heal()

      public void move(float speed)
      Moves the player in the current direction at a specified speed, adjusted by any extra speed.
      Overrides:
      move in class MovingEntity
      Parameters:
      speed - the base speed at which to move the player.

    • shoot

      public void shoot()
      Handles the player's ability to shoot bubbles. The player can shoot in the current direction if not obstructed by a wall, and shooting is temporarily disabled after each shot.
      Specified by:
      shoot in interface Shooting

    • stun

      public void stun(int stunTime)
      Stuns the player for time specified in the parameter.
      Parameters:
      stunTime - duration of the player stun

    • updateEntity

      public void updateEntity()
      Updates the player's state each game tick. This includes checking for collisions with bubbles, handling jumping, popping bubbles, updating position, applying gravity, and checking for life loss.
      Overrides:
      updateEntity in class MovingEntity
